text: Lighthouse is complaining that I have a large JS file without a sourcemap. As far as I know HubSpot doesn't allow .map files to be uploaded. Is there some way around this? I'm pretty sure inlining would result in a huge file...

On a related note, is there a plan to make this "possible improvement" to v2.js:
```A page or script is accessing at least one of navigator.userAgent, navigator.appVersion, and navigator.platform. In a future version of Chrome, the amount of information available in the User Agent string will be reduced.```
not really a big deal but I'm shooting for 100 in lighthouse and it seems to lower it
Try loading the forms using intersection observer
<@U38EZFVFE> Yea, I've done that before but it feels "wrong" for a reason I can't describe. That's likely the solution until HubSpot updates
On another related note, apparently there are more strict CSP requirements? <https://web.dev/csp-xss/?utm_source=lighthouse&utm_medium=devtools>
not really sure if this is something I can add or if HubSpot needs to on the server side
